rules.title: Enumerated Test Names
rules.message: Never use enumerated test names (test1, test2, testA). They provide no information about what the test verifies. Use descriptive names that describe the behavior being tested.

rules.title: Empty Test Bodies
rules.message: Never write tests without assertions. Empty tests pass but prove nothing. Every test must have at least one assertion.

rules.title: Hardcoded Sleep/Delays
rules.message: Never use hardcoded sleep/delays in tests. They make tests slow and flaky. Use waitFor, mock timers, or event-based waiting instead.

rules.title: Testing Private Methods Directly
rules.message: Never test private methods directly. It breaks encapsulation and couples tests to implementation. Test through the public interface.

rules.title: Unawaited Async Assertions
rules.message: Never leave async assertions unawaited. The promise is never awaited and the test passes even if the assertion fails. Always await or return the promise.

rules.title: Non-Descriptive Test Names
rules.message: Test names should describe the behavior being tested. Names like 'test', 'works', or 'it' provide no useful information.
